roleset.name: to become aware of, understand

example.name: perceive-v: all arguments
example.text: The U.S. wants the removal of what it perceives [*T*83] as barriers to investment ; Japan denies [0]there are real barriers .

example.name: perceive-v: transitive
example.text: Small investors perceive that `` big operators '' dominate the market , said [0] []Thomas O'Hara , chairman of the National Association of Investors and head of the exchange 's Individual Investors Advisory Committee set up after the 1987 crash .

example.name: perception-n: all args
example.text: shareholders' perception of Blue Arrow as a company in turmoil

example.name: perception-n: args 1 and 2
example.text: the perception of Mr. Honecker as an out-of-touch old man

example.name: perception-n: args 0 and 1
example.text: retail investors' perception of risks in the brokerage industry
example.arg: of risks in the brokerage industry

example.name: perception-n: One more with args 0 and 1
example.text: the public's perception of Al Gore

example.name: perception-n: sentencial complement as arg1
example.text: ... the situation in Lebanon will remain pending the clarification of perceptions that the American administration wants to adopt at the level of the region as a whole .
example.arg: that the American administration wants to adopt at the level of the region as a whole

roleset.note: PERCEIVE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'perceive' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from perceive.01-v predicate notes)
PERCEPTION-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to perceive.01. VN classes sight-30.2 and characterize-29.2. FN class perception_experience (from perception.01-n)

roleset.name: aware, sensitive to perception

example.name: perceptive-j
example.text: He was perceptive about the universal problems that had the ability to destroy mankind.
example.arg: about the universal problems that had the ability to destroy mankind.

roleset.note: PERCEPTIVE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS. (from perceptive.01-j)

roleset.name: ability to be detected

example.name: perceptibility-n
example.text: The perceptibility of a microwave field under experimental conditions

example.name: perceptible-j
example.text: But precisely in being so drawn, the will that wills nothing becomes perceptible to them as their force and their expressing.
example.arg: as their force and their expressing.

roleset.note: PERCEPTIBILITY-N, PERCEPTIBLE-J NOTES: Added by Julia while framing for clearearth-earthquakes.
